line_1: Next, because bus'ness now is all the vogue,
line_2: And who'd be quite polite must be a rogue,

line_1: From top to toe the Geta now in vogue;
line_2: You have two servants — Tom, an arch, sly rogue,

line_1: Can such wretches as you give to madness a vogue!
line_2: With you in the thirtieth! you impudent rogue!

line_1: Such is the blessed liberty in vogue,
line_2: The envied liberty to be a rogue;

line_1: There is no medium; for the term in vogue,
line_2: On either side is, honest man, or rogue.

line_1: And though it was a rule in vogue,
line_2: If one man call'd another rogue,
